file.content:
(use-package gptel
  :ensure (:host github :repo "karthink/gptel")
  :custom
  (gptel-model 'gpt-4.1)
  :hook (gptel-mode . visual-line-mode)

  :commands (gptel gptel-send gptel-mode gptel-menu))

(global-set-key (kbd "C-c RET") #'gptel-send)

(use-package claude-code
  :ensure (:type git :host github :repo "stevemolitor/claude-code.el" :branch "main" :depth 1
                 :files ("*.el" (:exclude "images/*")))
  :custom
  (claude-code-terminal-backend 'vterm)
  :config
  (add-to-list 'display-buffer-alist
               '("^\\*claude"
                 (display-buffer-in-side-window)
                 (side . right)
                 (window-width . 90)))
  
  ;; Override the transient key bindings to use Return instead of 'y' and Escape instead of 'n'
  (with-eval-after-load 'claude-code
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "y")
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient "Quick Responses"
      '("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return))
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient "Quick Responses"
      '("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)))
  
  (claude-code-mode))

(provide 'feat-ai)

content.text:
I can see the issue. The file ends at line 35, but you mentioned an error at lines 36-37. It looks like there might be some trailing content or the error message is pointing to a location that doesn't exist in the current file.

Could you share the specific error message you're seeing? This will help me understand what exactly is causing the problem with the key bindings configuration.

The code I can see looks syntactically correct - you're properly removing the old 'y' and 'n' bindings and adding new '<return>' and '<escape>' bindings to the claude-code transient menu.

message.content:
Cannot insert ("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return) into claude-code-transient; Quick Responses not found
Cannot insert ("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape) into claude-code-transient; Quick Responses not found

I'm getting this error

content.text:
The error indicates that the "Quick Responses" group doesn't exist in the `claude-code-transient` menu, so the `transient-append-suffix` calls are failing.

Let me fix this by creating the "Quick Responses" group first, then adding the key bindings to it:

input.old_string:
;; Override the transient key bindings to use Return instead of 'y' and Escape instead of 'n'
  (with-eval-after-load 'claude-code
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "y")
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient "Quick Responses"
      '("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return))
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient "Quick Responses"
      '("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)))
input.new_string:
;; Override the transient key bindings to use Return instead of 'y' and Escape instead of 'n'
  (with-eval-after-load 'claude-code
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "y")
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient :actions
      '["Quick Responses"
        ("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return)
        ("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)]))

content.text: It looks like the file has been completely replaced with just the provide statement. Let me restore the full configuration with the corrected key binding approach:

input.content:
(use-package gptel
  :ensure (:host github :repo "karthink/gptel")
  :custom
  (gptel-model 'gpt-4.1)
  :hook (gptel-mode . visual-line-mode)

  :commands (gptel gptel-send gptel-mode gptel-menu))

(global-set-key (kbd "C-c RET") #'gptel-send)

(use-package claude-code
  :ensure (:type git :host github :repo "stevemolitor/claude-code.el" :branch "main" :depth 1
                 :files ("*.el" (:exclude "images/*")))
  :custom
  (claude-code-terminal-backend 'vterm)
  :config
  (add-to-list 'display-buffer-alist
               '("^\\*claude"
                 (display-buffer-in-side-window)
                 (side . right)
                 (window-width . 90)))
  
  ;; Override the transient key bindings to use Return instead of 'y' and Escape instead of 'n'
  (with-eval-after-load 'claude-code
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "y")
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient :actions
      '["Quick Responses"
        ("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return)
        ("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)]))
  
  (claude-code-mode))

(provide 'feat-ai)

(use-package gptel
  :ensure (:host github :repo "karthink/gptel")
  :custom
  (gptel-model 'gpt-4.1)
  :hook (gptel-mode . visual-line-mode)

  :commands (gptel gptel-send gptel-mode gptel-menu))

(global-set-key (kbd "C-c RET") #'gptel-send)

(use-package claude-code
  :ensure (:type git :host github :repo "stevemolitor/claude-code.el" :branch "main" :depth 1
                 :files ("*.el" (:exclude "images/*")))
  :custom
  (claude-code-terminal-backend 'vterm)
  :config
  (add-to-list 'display-buffer-alist
               '("^\\*claude"
                 (display-buffer-in-side-window)
                 (side . right)
                 (window-width . 90)))
  
  ;; Override the transient key bindings to use Return instead of 'y' and Escape instead of 'n'
  (with-eval-after-load 'claude-code
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "y")
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient :actions
      '["Quick Responses"
        ("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return)
        ("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)]))
  
  (claude-code-mode))

(provide 'feat-ai)

content.text:
The fix changes the approach from trying to append to a non-existent "Quick Responses" group to creating a new group section with the key bindings. Instead of using `transient-append-suffix` with a group name that doesn't exist, it now appends to `:actions` and defines a new group vector with the title "Quick Responses" and the two key bindings.

This should resolve the error you were seeing.

message.content:
Cannot insert ["Quick Responses" ("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return) ("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)] into claude-code-transient; :actions not found

I'm getting this error. Ultrathink and find a good fix for this.

content.thinking:
The user is getting an error that `:actions` is not found in `claude-code-transient`. This suggests that we don't know the actual structure of the `claude-code-transient` menu. The approach of trying to append to specific sections isn't working because we're guessing at the structure.

Let me think about this differently. Instead of trying to modify the existing transient by appending to specific sections, I should:

1. First, try to understand what the actual structure of `claude-code-transient` is
2. Or, use a different approach that doesn't rely on knowing the exact structure

Some alternatives:
1. Use `transient-append-suffix` without specifying a group, just append to the end
2. Use `transient-insert-suffix` instead
3. Define our own transient menu that replaces the default one
4. Use a hook or advice to modify the key bindings after the transient is defined
5. Simply add global key bindings instead of modifying the transient

Let me think about the most robust approach. The error suggests that we're trying to insert into a structure that doesn't match what we expect. 

Looking at the original code, it was trying to:
1. Remove "y" and "n" suffixes
2. Append new suffixes to "Quick Responses"

But "Quick Responses" doesn't exist as a group. And now `:actions` doesn't exist either.

The most robust approach would be to:
1. Try to append the suffixes directly to the main transient without specifying a group
2. Or use a simpler approach like just adding the key bindings at the end

Let me try appending directly to the transient without specifying a section:

```elisp
(transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient nil
  '("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return))
(transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient nil
  '("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape))
```

I'll explore a more direct method of adding suffixes to the transient menu. The key is to use a simple, straightforward approach that doesn't rely on complex group structures. Appending directly to the end of the transient seems like the most reliable solution.

```elisp
(transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient nil
  '("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return))
(transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient nil
  '("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape))
```

This method ensures the new key bindings are added cleanly to the transient menu's end, providing a simple and effective way to extend the interface.

content.text: Looking at this error, the issue is that we're trying to append to sections of the transient that don't exist. Let me take a simpler approach - just append the key bindings directly to the end of the transient without specifying any particular section:

input.old_string:
;; Override the transient key bindings to use Return instead of 'y' and Escape instead of 'n'

    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "y")
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient :actions
      '["Quick Responses"
        ("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return)
        ("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)]))

  (with-eval-after-load 'claude-code

    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient nil
      '("<return>" "Send <return>" claude-code-send-return))
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient nil
      '("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)))

(use-package gptel
  :ensure (:host github :repo "karthink/gptel")
  :custom

  :hook (gptel-mode . visual-line-mode)

(use-package claude-code
  :ensure (:type git :host github :repo "stevemolitor/claude-code.el" :branch "main" :depth 1
                 :files ("*.el" (:exclude "images/*")))
  :custom
  (claude-code-terminal-backend 'vterm)
  :config
  (add-to-list 'display-buffer-alist
               '("^\\*claude"
                 (display-buffer-in-side-window)
                 (side . right)
                 (window-width . 90)))
  
  ;; Override the transient key bindings to use Return instead of 'y' and Escape instead of 'n'
  (with-eval-after-load 'claude-code
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "y")
    (transient-remove-suffix 'claude-code-transient "n")
    (transient-append-suffix 'claude-code-transient :actions

        ("<escape>" "Send <escape>" claude-code-send-escape)]))
  
  (claude-code-mode))

(provide 'feat-ai)

content.text: This approach uses `nil` as the location parameter for `transient-append-suffix`, which appends the key bindings to the end of the transient without trying to reference any specific group or section. This should avoid the "not found" errors you were seeing.
